label: Description
value: Arabesque panel composed of an urn in the center, springing from a base made up of acanthus leaves and vine tendrils.

Design for panel with carved trophies

label: Description
value: A crouching lion holds a sphere in its right forepaw at the foot of a palm tree, to which arms are fastened and topped by a legionary eagle.

value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: Scheme of a crest. A crest with Cupid and Psyche on a pedestal in the center and flanked by two seated female figures. Urns on pedestals rise between sphinxes. Garlands connect the motifs grasped by putti.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and blue, yellow, and pink wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a sepulchral wall monument

label: Description
value: Two richly decorated base sections over a dado. Their decorations include lions rampant and fleur de lys. The main section has a triangular pediment and contains an inscription tablet under the portrait bust of a member of the clergy. Laterally are more inscription tablets. A broken pediment with an escutcheon in the center, on top corner.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with blue wash on vellum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The top frieze depicts intertwined, curved bands with rosettes. The bottom frieze shows rosettes of alternating design.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Each rosette is shown against a black background in a square.

value: Transcribed from label: " Decloux Purchase 1911 "Original drawings purchaced by the Council ( last word covered by tape)" "

label: Description
value: Folding door with a similar lunette section over a horizontal beam. The decoration consists of two tablets on pedestals and molded framings; square rocaille motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and water color, graphite on paper

label: Credit line

Design for an entrance wall to a music or dance hall

label: Description
value: Five bays with a door opening with curtains in the center flanked by framed panels with dancers over sofas. The overdoors show Arion at left and a maenad at right. The decoration of the ceiling cove refers to Music and Poetry. Homer, Apollo, and a poet are the subjects of the painting in the frieze.

label: Physical description
value: Ben and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Tapestry: Bacchus and Ariadne

label: Description
value: Bacchus with his procession passing Ariadne, points to her. Framing of scrollwork with garlands of vine and fruit, herms, satyr children.

value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, black chalk on paper

value: A niche in each bay contains a vase with flowers and topped by a medallion and garlands. Three alternative designs are suggested for the decoration of the frieze.

Project for Tapestry Dedicated to Farm Life

label: Description
value: Colonnade of Ionic order with garlands of flowers twisted and festooned between the fluted columns. Suspended in the intercolumniations are trophies of garden implements and other attributes of agricultural life. On the ground, behind the colonnade appear dogs, peacocks, fowl, a fox in a trap and geese. Border in ink frames scene.-Based on text by R. Berliner

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Acquired from the Collection of Léon Decloux after 1906

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A burning brazier rises from an urn, with two sirens as handles. A leaf arabesque connects with a seated female sphinx, right, from whose head springs a cornucopia.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and sepia ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The zodiac with the twins are at the center of the composition. In the right corner, Auora and a puti are seated on clouds with an overflowing urn.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Ceiling of the Church of the Gesù, Rome, Italy

label: Description
value: Sketch of the Church of the Gesù ceiling, painted by Giovanni Battista Gaulli (called "Il Baciccio"), showing the Triumph of the Nature of Jesus. The painted decoration is contained between four windows at either side.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and grey watercolor on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The main decoration consists of escutcheons. Those in the bottom row are empty, except for the central one, in which is written: "questo e la parte/din anzi." St. Jerome, a Pope, St. Francis, Bishops are represented over the seats. Upon the back corners are statues of St. Luke, at left, St. Mark, at right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and bistre wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A panel with an elaborated marble fountain is flanked by two doors, halves of which are shown. The overdoors show griffons flanking urns.

label: Physical description
value: pen and ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Frontal elevation of a wrought-iron balcony supported on carved stone brackets. The central motif consists of a rosette within a studded circle, and vegetal arabesques at either side. At the ends, two vertical panels with similar motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, graphite-ruled borders in pen and black ink on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The wall is divided into four panels and separated by pilasters. The panels on the right include trophies with religious attributes. Above two of the panels are lunettes. The left lunette contains musical instruments and the right lunette has religious implements.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, inkwash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Tureen and a Platter

label: Description
value: Tureen in elevation, platter in plan.  The left and right halves of the tureen body are slightly different, as alternative designs. Crowned escutcheon in center of body.  Various plants and crayfish form knop.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and brown ink, brush and sepia wash on two joined sheets of paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Sanguine is used for the forepart of the dog and the head of the sheep. An altar with heart lying on it in a tree-filled landscape; dog and sheep in foreground. Shepherdess’s hat and staff.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, sanguine on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The obliquely shown fountain consists of a basin in the shape of a boat in which a shell with children and sea animals is supported by a dragon and children. The children pour water at each other or the dragon. A hedge with arched openings is supposed to form an enclosure. Framing ink lines. Paper margin.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and white gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Boat-Shaped Vessel, possibly intended as a Festival Float

label: Description
value: A ship-shaped bowl, supported by two mermaids, is surmounted upon a base representing the sea. The bowl is flanked by two high columns with mermaid finials connected to each other by a pole entwined with ribbon. Traces of framing lines are visible at the edges of the sketch.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: P.J. Mariette [1]; Count J.P van Suchtelen [2]; Hippolyte Destailleur [3]; Léon Decloux; 1911: acquired by Museum            [1] Lugt 1852 [2] Lugt 2332 [3] Collection no. 493

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

value: A ship-shaped bowl, supported by two mermaids, is surmounted upon a base representing the sea. The bowl is flanked by two high columns with mermaid finials connected to each other by a pole entwined with ribbon. Traces of framing lines are visible at the edges of the sketch.
